reviews.review:
Juste ÉNORME, surement l'un des meilleurs jeux de ces 10 dernières années. 
Un scénario et des personnages cultes, des musiques tout aussi sublimes, et un level design proche de la perfection, rien que ça.
Aucune hésitation possible, foncez.
As good as the first - coop is the best

This is a fantastic game and I would be brazen enough to say its the best sequel I've ever played.

Compliments aside I must issue a caveat: If you're only in this game for the gameplay then this will likely be an ill-advised purchase. The game is very short and while it does shine like a diamond for the 6+ hours in its single player campaign (the co-op campaign is also very promising) those with only a casual interest will likely feel a little robbed by the $50 price tag.

However, if you don't own the first Portal (in which case I'm amazed you exist) then the deal for both games is well worth it as both games are easily worth the $25 dollars between them.

Overall? If you don't overhype the game and can apprieciate the excellent writing and storytelling then you will not be dissapointed.
Portal 2 represents everything I love in gaming.  It entertained, it challenged and it rewarded.  A memorable experience crafted by the best in the industry.
This is the best game ever!
You must buy this game. For science!
FUCK YEAH
One of my top three games of all time.
Such an Awesome game! The test chambers once you get to the old aperture science areas are completely mindblowingly awesome.

A piece of art :3
Must have!

Finest  Co-Op content EVAR!! My only gripe is that there is not more of it to play. 
Seriously though, with 4 years development and such awesome fun in co op play it makes little to no sense why this game was released with 5 times as many single player than over co-op's.  I mean really, we played portals and loved it and are happy to have such a polished new version, but come on! I went through all the co -ops with in a few hours.   

   I am sure there will be more maps to come. Just kinda sucks that the best quality of this game is also the most lacking in content.
I felt legitimately depressed when I beat this, it was that good... Nostalgic memories.

SINGLE PLAYER!! AMAZING... CO-OP MULTIPLAYER.. DOUBLE THE AWESOME.. plenty of challenging puzzles.. developers tools coming soon.. anybody that hasnt played portal.. totally should!!!! GLaDOS is the most awesome villan in a video game everrrr!!!!!!
Best game ever ?
Fantastic singleplayer, challenging co-op puzzles, and best of all it has been patched several times already to insure that the game's quality stays top notch!

This is the kind of game Jesus would make if he were alive... and a game programmer... and not a douche. All the game was foreplay up to the balls tighteningly epic ending the left me climaxing in my pants. Seriously this is the most fun you will have with your computer untill they create a force feedback codpeice! Worth every penny. See you in the multiplayer! Seriously, I need more people to multiplayer with, it's an achievement requirement.

Melhor jogo de todos os tempos. 

11/10
This game is awesome :) Just shame about the "Robot Enrichment" which basically is the same as the TF2 shop.. which I hate.
Very fun game, everyone should check it out.

This Games are Just Awesome But Co Op need some more Levels ;D ^^ Rating of 10 
9 Valve 4live

I'm a big fan of Valve games since the first Half Life and Portal 1 was their greatest game I might say.
And then Portal 2 came around and wow ! Right from the start I was mind blown. More fun, more laughs, more tricky, more good looking, more well written story and dialogs, more everything. If you liked the first one, you'll fall in love with the second and it will probably leave you with a tear on your eye.

Portal 2 is THE Game Of The Year, period !

It has been a loooong time since I felt the same sense of wonderment and awe playing a game as I have in Portal 2. I also haven't laughed as hard at a game in even longer, if ever. It's brilliantly written, incredibly well designed, and as immersive as the original Half-LIfe.  Simply an astounding game.
One of the funniest and most unique game series I have ever played. And this second installment gives me no other choice than to tounge valves asshole in appreciation.

Mantiene la misma dinamica que Portal, solo que esta vez la campaña, en vez de ser un POC, es una obra maestra de la creacion de buenos juegos. Desde los graficos hasta el sonido, pasando por los diseños de niveles y el guion de los personajes, TODO tiene un nivel altisimo de calidad. La unica queja que se podria formular es la dificultad, que podria ser algo mas elevada.

MULTPLAYER:
Lo mas entretenido y adictivo que he jugado en muchisimo tiempo, tiene un modo cooperativo que en mi opinion, supera con creces al de Left 4 Dead.
Good Game

Portal 2 is everything that the original was and more.  The replayability is pretty low unless you're an achievment whore or suffer from short term memory loss.

Source has never looked this good, and the storyline is epic as hell.  I don't regret paying full retail for this title.
This is a truly amazing game, well worth the money. This is the best single player game I have ever played and has a fantastic co op. My game of the year by far!
great game but still short on content.  the single player took me maybe 12 hrs to complete, probably a bit less.  hopefully more maps and content will come out or some user created stuff.
Awesome game! One of the best puzzle platformers in the last couple years.
TOTALLY WORTH IT
If you liked Portal, get it.  If you never played Portal, get it.  If you played Portal and didn't like it, you're not a real person.
Justifies all the hype.  This is just sublime.  Broader in humour and in scope.  If Half-Life 2 Episode 3 is half as good as this it will be incredible.  You really should play this game.
One of the best games I've ever played.

#1 Alright, let's go
#2 Charge!
#1 Hmm... okay. I'm gonna fire here and here. We can go up now.
#2 Cool, I'll shoot here and here.
#1 Nice, we're going good. Wait, where are you?
#2 *Places second portal elsewhere*
#1 *Dies* WTF?! Why did you let me die?!
#2 Achievement Yay! *Log off*
Just as much fun as the original. Takes a bit for the puzzles to get challenging, but you still have to think!
fun
Bro. Yes.
epic

Portal 1, but with an actual story, more humor, far far far more puzzles, less fiddley quick portalling, new mechanics and possible puzzles, as well as new funny characters, great graphics and music. An excellent single player game and coop just adds even more. Plus it has potatoes.
If you like Puzzle games, and/or played the first Portal, you will love Portal 2. Puzzles are challenging, but not too difficult. 10/10
http://lucidonline.net/2011/04/portal-2-pc/
Geiler geht's nimmer!
Endlich mal etwas anspruchsvoller :) Auch wenn Einzelspieler und Coop Modus in untern 12 Stunden blind schaffbar sind...

A Masterpiece of a game.

A story so great you'll be hooked instantly

Portal 2 is something you will remember forever
A worthy sequel to the original Portal. Great Story, Great Gameplay [9/10]

Amazing game, just incredible. Extremely good and funny dialogue, graphics are great, as well as the environments, not to forget the really original story. Plus, it's co-op as well as singeplayer! You won't forget this game soon, worth the money.

Portal 2 is in many ways it's predecessor Portal, amplified one hundred times over. 

Portal 2 has taken the Portal franchise to a whole new level with a vastly expanded storyline that explains a lot more within the Portal universe, such as the origin of GLaDOS. 

The game also has a wider variety of differant levels, not only standard chambers similar to it's predecessor, but the bowls of the facility, allowing you to see much more of Aperture Science than before. The actual test chambers have been improved, containing more "apparatus" such as the Thermal Discouragement Beam  along with bigger and better puzzles.

The game itself also has more replay value than the first Portal with the new co-op mode, allowing you and your friends to venture through test chambers together as customizable androids.

Overall Portal 2 is an exemplary example of a fresh and exciting first-person game, if you enjoyed Portal, or just wish to try something new, I would recommend purchasing this game.

Forget all you know about genuine science. THIS, is science at its finest! 
It's time to live a different experience in the depths of Aperture Laboratories. 

A wonderful storyline, original new mechanics, and a lot of clever puzzles, the best of its kind! Portal 2 is a unique game and a must-have for any puzzle-game lover. The only game I've ever pre-ordered back in 2011, and I don't regret any of the 50€ I spent for this gem!

It comes with a Test Chamber editor that is ridiculously easy to use and will let you create all the puzzles you want. It is truly addictive!

I'd like to leave a special mention for the high quality of the French dubbing. Wheatley is voiced by Guillaume Lebon, who's my favourite french voice actor ever. He made me fall in love with this game, no doubt!
As good as the first.

The story is pretty FUCKING amazing, puzzles are challenging but yet simple and approachable, overall this game is a must have.

Story 10/10
개쩜

Perfektes Gameplay! Wer auf Puzzle's steht ist hier genau richtig, mit einem guten schuss Humor. Für mich ein Titel der neueren Spiele die es in meine All-Time-Favourite's schaffen könnte (Die hauptsächlich aus alten Retro Spielen besteht, und so mit der erste wäre der neuen Generation Games). Ein absolutes Must-Have!
Portal 1 was experiment.This is a REAL Portal game.
Seaking.

Just finished story mode with a mixed feeling. But, WHAT A RIDE!!!
Over all the test chambers are easy to figure out and not hard at all if you already finish portal 1's advanced/challenge maps. But story wise I'd still think they leave some major part of it unexplained. With comic, in game story building, and portal 1, I still feel lack of satisfaction( guess I want more out of it). And there are no advanced/challenge maps available after finished single player mode, I guess it's for later update?

Portal 2 is still highly recommended, but I would suggest actually finish Portal 1 that comes with your purchase so the experience is more compelete.

Kudos to Portal 2 team! I love your game.

Single player has been extended and has more challenging puzzles, the dialogue well written and performed, the story is immersive and has some great twists, and multiplayer is a fun-filled addition to the game although it's a bit shorter than I would have liked.

I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this game anyway, especially for seasoned veterans of the original Portal game.
Fly me to the moon and let me, Play amongst the stars.

Portal 2 isn't some run of the mill Call of Duty game, it's a purely amazing work of art and creative genius. The single player campaign tackles Aperture Science 500 years into the future, with an all new antagonist, and undiscovered test chambers and areas.

If you buy one game this year, Portal 2 would be the game to buy(unless of course, Episode 3 is next to it on the shelf, in which case you buy both).

“Portal 2” is a worthy successor to “Portal”.

It is very enjoyable to play through, though being a sequal it is not as original as the first. If you have never played Portal I would still recommend this game as it does a very good job of introducing you to Portals.

It's biggest flaw is probably caused by console-itus. By that I mean it feels easier than the original. When you first break out of the test chambers with your portal gun in-hand during the first "Portal" you feel like the possibilities are limitless; that you could go anywhere. Using your portal gun to by-pass fences, elevator shafts and crushers you could do anything. Portal 2 totally removed this feeling by putting a single square of white paint in the few places you could actually use a portal. Thus spoon feeding you all the solutions.

That said it is a great game only made greater by some excellently voiced characters. GLaDos makes the obvious comeback, but Wheatley is the new star. And I have hit the word cap...

There's a hole in the sky
Through which we can fly
Best Valve Game EVER!

This is such a perfectly crafted game, and very well worth the entry fee. The game is excellently well written, sounds fantastic and still manages to look great.

You'll be trolled, shocked, and laugh out loud during this game. Don't spoil it for yourself, experience Portal 2. It's amazing.
Shits all over the original
AMAZING!! Killing team mates doesnt get old :)
Awesome. But you already knew that.
Epic! Well worth the money.

Simply one of the best games of 2011, Visually awe-inspiring, witty and comical story dialogue, and more of an action adventure than a FPS Puzzle shooter like the first one. Co-Op is worth it, and fun as hell.
SPAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

English: Wow. Awesome singleplayer, well worth the money! I've invested 15 hrs into the SP (Hunting of achievements inclusive ;D) and I haven't even started the Co-Op mode yet!^^

Deutsch: Unfassbar guter Singleplayer-Modus. Absolut jeden Cent wert. War 15 Sunden am SP dran (inkl. Achievement-Hunting ;D) und ich hab noch net mal den Co-Op angefangen!^^
Better than the first.  Must have game of 2011.
This is the best game ever!
Best game ever. :D
Great great great great game! A videogame gem :D

What can I say... Fan of Portal 1 and this one just surpassed it all around. The added Co-op feature was just iciing on the cake. Didn't feel as short as the first one on SP and then adding in the time spent on co-op it just exceeds all my expectations for Portal 2. Recommend buying this one! Also if you haven't played the first one I would really recommened going through that first the story does carry over and you will be happier doing so.

I can't understand why anyone hasn't already got and played this game. It is an amazing game that I litteraly can't express how much I enjoyed it. It was much better than the original (which is saying alot). They kept all the great elements from 1 and added even greater content. The dialogue was incredibly witty and funny, with great voice work. The graphics got a major overhaul, I was speechless at some really beautiful scenes. Also, the Co-op campaign was so much fun. With a great combination of teamwork and thinking needed its the perfect multiplayer mode for this game. Portal 2 also has a great diffucutly curve, with the original challenges simple for new players (or people who havn't played in a long time) and quickly get more complicated. With a great story, funny characters, beautiful graphics and even pretty good music, Portal 2 is a game I'll be enjoying for a Very Long Time. And I can't wait for the next Portal!

Best game of the year. Awesome story,  Surprise twist ending (I seriously did not expect that to work, and the achievement was aptly described.:That  just happened. Because I said out loud to myself, oh no that did NOT just happen)

Anyway, get it, it's fun. Co-op is fun too. Hope there's some more expansion material coming though cause it needed to be longer.

This is an Epic Game with an Epic Story Line.

Even though It may be a little short (but still MUCH longer then the first one), the GREAT storyline make's up for it.

It really connects great with the first one, so if you haven't played it, then make sure to play it first, else you may be a little lost in this one.
You already KNOW why you should be playing this.
Best... Game... Evar.

Great follow-up to the amazing first game.  It definitely lives up to the hype, unlike many other games now-a-days.  A very enjoyable, and humorous, single player experience, plus a separate coop mode so you can enjoy it with a friend.  A must buy!
Almost better than the original, except it is.

More twists than a thai hooker. The greatest sequil to a video game I've ever seen since you could connect Sonic 3 to Sonic and Knuckles. I prey they make a sequil or expansion in some form. While a little shorter than I hoped taking into consideration Portal was one of my favorite games of all time, quickly replaced by Portal 2. It feels less like a sequil and more like an expansion or true "part 2" which makes it all the sweeter. I almost cried at the end, a true blue wrap up that I personally hope is somehow expanded upon.

Portal 2 is pretty much the greatest gaming experence I have ever come across in my     20+ years of playing videogames in general. Smooth as silk, as polished as the Queens silver, this game delivers in an awesome way. Coop only adds to the replay value not to mention the added greatness overall.

OK, I'll do a more detailed review on this game. 

This game is definetely one of the best single player video games I have ever played. Just like all valve single player games I find myself desiring to play the whole game all over again. This is something that I've only experienced with valve games and with warioland.

Co-op sounds great, but unless you play the game the same day it is released you're never going to get a chance to play co-op with anyone. The game was released while I was quite literally fucking my girlfriend so hard and making her scream till the point that the neighbours complained. By the time I got a chance to play the game (wednesday night) Everyone on steam had already played co-op so now I will never know what it is even like, let alone whether it is good or not.

Tl;dr version: fuc
You're an idiot if you don't play this.
A MUST BUY. NO REALLY GO BUY AND PLAY RIGHT NOW!!!

Portal 2 > Portal
Need I say more?
Si vous ne deviez jouer qu'à un seul FPS, que ce soit pour sa campagne solo ou pour mode coopératif, ce doit être Portal 2 !
Simplesmente mais uma obra prima da Valve.

これは夏に薄い本が出るな…
Un jeu qui sort de l'ordinaire et dont l'univers est très accrocheur. Un de mes coup de coeur de moment.
Probably Valves best game yet, so no pressure on buying it and all

[iphone woodchime rings] Hello? - Yeah, it's me. - Not bad; how are you? - I've been playing it too. - Yeah, it's absolutely striking. The little world they've created is enormous and it's deeper than a salt mine.  - Right. - Cave Johnson, yeah. - Oh, all three of the voiceover characters are fantastic but it's absolutely GLADos' game. And, you know, the three act structure lets them stretch the game without it getting tiring. They flow well too: very Bioshock-esque. - Plus, you forget that you're doing puzzles slash science at times. - Well and that's the crazy thing, right: It makes Half Life feel small. - Can't wait for them to bring this new storytelling and design skill back to Black Mesa. - Yeah, let's do it. See you in-game.

A bigger and slightly more challenging version of the first game with even more talking robots (which could be a good or bad thing!).  Co-op features are nice as is the longer singleplayer and bigger budget, though I really hope Valve adds challenge maps in a future update!
I agree with its Best PC Game and Best Action/Adventure Game of 2011 CAUSE ITS SO FREAKING EPICCCCCC!!!!!

Excelente juego, mejor que el primero porque es mas largo, mayor contenido, modo cooperativo,etc

Las gráficas están del carajo aunque las texturas podian ser mejor. El dialogo del juego esta a otro nivel de divertido, te reirás con la rompedera de GLADoS y Cave Johnson, voice acting del carajo

Pronto saldrá el SDK y vendrá la lluvia de mapas custom, así que eso le añadirá longevidad al juego si lo que te interesa es el reto..
Unless Diablo III or GW2 comes out anytime soon (doubt it), I'm calling it early and saying this is Game of the Year 2011.

What can i fucking say, this game is str8 up beastified ownage. Amazing game, single player way longer than the first game, and co op is EPIC. Cannot wait until the SDK gets released and there will be plenty CO op maps for eeveryone to play!
Must Have!!!
